qas.question: What are waders called in North America?
Where do dunlin Calidris alpina migrate to?

answers.text: warmer locations in the same hemisphere

qas.question: Where do semiplamated sandpiper C. pusilla migrate to?

answers.text: the tropics in the Southern Hemisphere

qas.question: Where do western sandpiper Calidris migrate from?

context: A similar situation occurs with waders (called <a0_0>shorebirds<a0_0/> in North America). Many species, such as dunlin Calidris alpina and western sandpiper Calidris mauri, undertake long movements from their <a3_0>Arctic breeding grounds<a3_0/> to <a1_0>warmer locations in the same hemisphere<a1_0/>, but others such as semipalmated sandpiper C. pusilla travel longer distances to <a2_0>the tropics in the Southern Hemisphere<a2_0/>.
